intro: Mahurea exstipulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mahurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically sessile or have very short stalks. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have five petals. Mahurea exstipulata is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils.
